p: Basil and citronella oils exhibited significant reductions on bean weight and the number of beans damaged by A. obtectus when greater doses were applied over beans. In addition, the high doses (60 and 120 μL) of basil oil generated a greater concentration of holes in the damaged beans, showing the toxic activity of this essential oil through its Linallol component [ 42]. The behavior and/or repellency shown by A. obtectus towards treated beans has also been observed by Rodríguez-González et al. [ 66] using biological control agents.
